title: Obama condemns rioters as 'criminals and thugs'
description: Baltimore residents wonder how to stop the violence from happening again. FULL STORY | PHOTOS

title: Angry mom smacks protesting son
description: A mom furious at her son for apparently taking part in the Baltimore riots has become a sensation online.

title: Iran seizes ship; U.S. responds
description: Iran Revolutionary Guard patrol boats fired shots across the bow of and later intercepted a commercial cargo ship, the M/V Maersk Tigris, which was crossing the Strait of Hormuz Tuesday morning, according to a senior U.S. military official.

title: Earthquake toll passes 4,600
description: More than 4,600 people dead. Over 9,000 injured. Eight million affected across Nepal. One million children urgently in need of help.

title: Same-sex marriage goes before Supreme Court
description: Update 11:13 a.m.: The man who disrupted court arguments this morning was yelling and screaming outside the courtroom doors before police officers dragged him out of the building and put him in handcuffs, according to Lane Hudson, a witness who was standing outside the courtroom doors.

title: Bumble Bee charged after worker's death in oven
description: Bumble Bee Foods and two employees face felony criminal charges in the 2012 death of Jose Melena, an employee who died in a pressure cooker. KCAL/KCBS reports.

title: Nine executed by firing squad
description: The families of death row prisoners who are expected to be executed within the next 24 hours by Indonesian firing squad made their final visit Tuesday to the island where they're being held.

title: Defense: Rob Tsarnaev of death
description: How do you defend the indefensible?

title: Angry college professor fails entire class
description: A professor at Texas A&M Galveston said in an email to his strategic management students that they were a disgrace, that they lacked maturity -- and that he would fail the entire class.

title: Hundreds of decomposed corpses found
description: Hundreds of decomposed corpses were discovered buried in shallow graves in the streets of the northeastern Nigerian town of Damasak this past weekend, according to local officials and a resident.

title: Jeb Bush pushes for Puerto Rico statehood
description: Jeb Bush reiterated his support for Puerto Rico statehood on Tuesday, telling a crowd that he's long been a supporter of the movement to make the U.S. territory the 51st state.

title: Nepal struggles to cope with international aid
description: Countries around the world have launched massive aid operations to help victims of the Nepal earthquake, but distribution of aid faces challenges as Nepal is still trying to come to terms with the scale of the disaster.

title: Alligator trainer attacked during show
description: An alligator trainer was attacked while performing a show in Texas. CNN affiliate KTRK reports.

title: Two-way mirror found in bar's bathroom stall
description: Two-way mirror faces the ladies' toilet in a Chicago bar. Jeanne Moos reports the mirror is reflecting poorly in the bar's Yelp ratings.

title: Tony Awards nominations announced
description: The nominations for the 69th Annual Tony Awards were announced Tuesday morning.

title: 32 amazing sports photos
Lifetime making 'Full House' tell-all movie
description: Have Mercy! Lifetime has its follow-up to its "Unauthorized Saved By the Bell" TV movie: the network is now taking on Full House.

title: 3.69-carat diamond found in Arkansas park
description: Can a prayer for diamonds actually turn up a gem?

title: 5 ways to wear natural hair - and look amazing
description: From curly and coily to just a hint of kink, African women across the continent are embracing the natural hair movement.

title: On board with bionic bartenders
description: When Royal Caribbean's huge Anthem of the Seas cruise ship rumbled smoothly out to sea on its maiden commercial trip last week, it carried a strange cargo alongside its 4,000-plus passengers.

title: World's fastest train takes you a mile in 10 seconds
description: The Japanese Maglev train crushed its own world record by traveling at 374 miles per hour for nearly 11 seconds. Check out the train in action.

title: Man reunited with baby found in dumpster 25 years ago
description: A police officer in California is reunited with a man he found as a baby in a dumpster 25 years ago. CNN affiliate KCAL/KCBS reports.

title: Model: Cop slammed my face into glass table
description: A California woman explains why she is suing Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department after a nightclub arrest. CNN affiliate KSNV reports.

title: This habit could be as harmful as smoking
description: Sitting can be dangerous to your health. Dr. Sanjay Gupta tell us how moving more could help us live to 100.

title: The men who sell flowers in India
Erupting volcanoes that can be seen from space
Surreal photos of classic fairy tales
description: You don't have to be well-versed in Russian folklore to appreciate this dream-like take on classic stories.

title: The week in 37 photos
Landmarks before and after
Families ripped apart by earthquake
description: By the time you reach the outskirts of Nepal's capital, even the roads are showing signs of the sheer magnitude of this earthquake -- and the enormity of the task awaiting a country struggling to come to terms with devastation and tragedy.

title: Panorama of devastation in Nepal
description: A magnitude-7.8 earthquake centered less than 50 miles from Kathmandu rocked Nepal with devastating force April 25, authorities said.

title: 10 deadliest earthquakes in history
description: The devastating 2010 earthquake in Haiti tops the list of 10 deadliest earthquakes, according to the United States Geological Survey.

title: Does A380 superjumbo have a future?
Bruce Jenner's ex-wife talks about their relationship
description: Actress Linda Thompson, Bruce Jenner's second wife, says she can "breathe a little easier" knowing her ex-husband has found the strength to publicly declare he is transgender.

title: What Bush said about Obama
description: President George W. Bush's former spokesman Ari Fleischer -- who was the one to question Bush during a weekend event -- pushed back strongly on Monday against media reports that Bush criticized President Barack Obama's foreign policy on Iran and ISIS.

title: Roseanne Barr's blindness, how to prevent it
description: The comic shared her struggle with macular degeneration and glaucoma, which can be protected against.

title: 3 years after theater massacre, trial begins
description: James Holmes will stand trial Monday in the Aurora, Colorado, movie theater shooting where he allegedly killed 12 people and injured 58 more in 2012. The trial could last until autumn.

title: Fitness guru called fat; see her viral response
description: YouTube fitness star Cassey Ho responded to negative comments about her looks in a video that has gone viral.

title: Paralyzed teen's surprise brings nurse to tears
description: After being paralyzed for nearly two weeks, a Texas teenager surprised the nurse who inspired her during rehab. CNN affiliate KTVT reports.

title: You could be seeing more of Japan's military
description: The United States and Japan announced big changes Monday to the guidelines that will govern the defense relationship between the two countries going forward.

title: Police seek UFC fighter after hit-and-run
description: One of the biggest stars in mixed martial arts is wanted for questioning after a hit-and-run crash in New Mexico.
